items.title: New York Today: City of Stunts
items.abstract: What you need to know for Thursday: a brief history of mischief, a sunnier day, and memories of Lauren Bacall.

items.title: As Delta Risk Looms, New York City Scales Back Covid Monitoring
items.abstract: The positive test rate in the city has crept up near 1 percent in recent days.

items.title: In Berlin, a Space for Design Experiments
items.abstract: Bocci has moved past its humble 2005 beginnings in a red Canadian barn and leased a 22,000-square-foot derelict courthouse in the Charlottenburg district.

items.title: Gehry Design for Philadelphia Museum of Art to Be Displayed
items.abstract: The new design for the Philadelphia Museum of Art will be unveiled July 1 at the museum.

items.title: City Ballet’s ‘Robbins 100’: Making Music Theatrical
items.abstract: One lesson of New York City Ballet’s Jerome Robbins celebration concerned his musicality, which often points to parts of the score left undanced.
